snippet: Yahoo is seeking to force Facebook into licensing 10 to 20 patents over technologies that include advertising, the personalization of Web sites, social networking and messaging, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.
abstract: Yahoo is seeking to force Facebook into licensing 10 to 20 patents over technologies that include advertising, the personalization of Web sites, social networking and messaging, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.

headline.main: Yahoo Warns Facebook of a Potential Patent Fight

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

snippet: Motorola Mobility, soon to be part of Google, is willing to pay you to buy one of its phones. The company is starting a trade-in program on Tuesday, offering up to $200 to people who swap their older devices for a Motorola smartphone that comes wi...
abstract: Motorola Mobility, soon to be part of Google, is willing to pay you to buy one of its phones. The company is starting a trade-in program on Tuesday, offering up to $200 to people who swap their older devices for a Motorola smartphone that comes with Google's Android software.

headline.main: Motorola Lures Professionals With a Trade-In Program

snippet: The companies have exceeded their own predictions and, by most estimations, the expectations of many in an industry now dominated by Apple, Google and Samsung.
abstract: Nokia and Microsoft, one year after start of their software alliance, have exceeded their own predictions and, by most estimations, the expectations of many; Nokia introduces new cellphones and will open new Windows online marketplaces in 28 countries by March.

headline.main: One Year Later, Nokia and Microsoft Deliver
headline.print_headline: One Year Later, Nokia And Microsoft Deliver

snippet: Ways to learn about leap day and the intricacies of how the calendar works.
abstract: Ways to learn about leap day and the intricacies of how the calendar works.

headline.main: 10 Activities for Learning About Leap Year and Other Calendar Oddities

byline.original: By PATRICK HONNER and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

snippet: Facebook wants to be the king of the mobile Web. At the Mobile World Congress, Bret Taylor, Facebook's chief technology officer, announced a series of efforts to simplify the development of applications that can run on mobile-friendly Web sites.
abstract: Facebook wants to be the king of the mobile Web. At the Mobile World Congress, Bret Taylor, Facebook's chief technology officer, announced a series of efforts to simplify the development of applications that can run on mobile-friendly Web sites.

headline.main: Facebook Makes Push for Beefed-Up Mobile Sites

snippet: Andy Rubin, the head of Google's Android efforts, acknowledges that, unlike smartphones, tablets running Android have yet to gain much traction among consumers. He vows that that will change this year as Google makes more of a concerted effort to ...
abstract: Andy Rubin, the head of Google's Android efforts, acknowledges that, unlike smartphones, tablets running Android have yet to gain much traction among consumers. He vows that that will change this year as Google makes more of a concerted effort to build an ecosystem of app developers for the tablets, which will spur greater consumer interest.

snippet: It appears to be only a matter of time before Nokia and Microsoft get into the tablet computer business. Stephen Elop, the Nokia chief executive, said in an interview that the Finnish handset maker was looking closely at the possibility of produci...
abstract: It appears to be only a matter of time before Nokia and Microsoft get into the tablet computer business. Stephen Elop, the Nokia chief executive, said in an interview that the Finnish handset maker was looking closely at the possibility of producing a tablet computer with Microsoft.

headline.main: Nokia Exploring Tablet Computer With Microsoft

snippet: Nokia and Microsoft hope the new model will help them take market share from Apple's iPhone and others running Google's Android software.

headline.main: Nokia to Offer Lower-Priced Windows Cellphone
headline.print_headline: Nokia to Offer Lower-Priced Windows Cellphone

snippet: Those who criticized the Spanish phone company Telefónica’s purchase of control of a Chilean mobile operator in 1992 have long since fallen silent.
